titlestmt.titleproper: Dan La Botz Socialist Party of Ohio U.S. Senate Campaign (2010) Records TAM.565
titlestmt.author: Peter M. Filardo

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:56:19 -0400.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Dan La Botz Socialist Party of Ohio U.S. Senate Campaign (2010) Records

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Dan La Botz in 2010; additional materials were donated in 2013. The accession numbers associated with this collectin are 2011.006 and 2013.031.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dan La Botz (1945- ) was the Socialist Party of Ohio's 2010 candidate for the U.S. Senate.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Dan La Botz Socialist Party of Ohio U.S. Senate Campaign (2010) Records; TAM 565; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This unprocessed collection contains materia relating to La Botz's 2010 Socialist Party campain for Ohio U.S. Senate. The materials include correspondence (with voters, government bodies, the mass media, other (progressive organizations, etc.), a campaign diary, handwritten notes, materials relating to a compliant filed with the FCC (Federal Communications Commission), campaign literature and related printed ephemera, a book-length typescript "A Vision from the Heartland: Socilalism for the 21st Century," and two DVDs containing television appearances and other events.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection, created by Dan La Botz, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
